Name: Physics: An Incremental Development, Home Study Packet

ReviewList.Text: This was NOT the textbook. This was a thin paper back packet of the tests for the physics book. There is nowhere on the advertisement that states that this is a test booklet. It only states that it is a hard cover, which I thought implies a book. My search also included "Saxon Physics BOOK". It was not for the test booklet. It was for the text. The picture and the name listed matched the textbooks picture and name. I don't understand. I do not feel I errored. And now the stores wants me to repackage it and send back for a full refund and not for the replacment of the book. I feel that they mislead me. They asked an inexpensive price and I bit. I'm annoyed and unhappy with the misrepresentation.

Don't let the name "packet" fool you.  When you buy this product new, it includes both the tests and the answers to the tests.  This "packet" only includes the answers to the tests, not a very useful book.
